title: Drawing, "The Seasons Bring Gifts to Ceres and Triptolemus", 1812
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on light brown paper and secondary support
inscribed: Inscribed at top with graphite: Sopra la bocca d'opera; with pen: prima dedit legis: cereris sunt omnia muneis.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Ceres and Triptolemus shown entroned upon platform. Seasons kneel or come at left. At right, sketch in margin showing part of throne and platform and Ceres and Triptolemus, who holds cornucopia.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "The Seasons Bring Gifts to Ceres and Triptolemus", 1812.
1812. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on light brown paper and secondary support. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3285.
